greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array T(n,k), n >= 0, k >= 0, read by antidiagonals, where column k is the expansion of sqrt(2 / ( (1-2*(k+4)*x+((k-4)*x)^2) * (1+(k-4)*x+sqrt(1-2*(k+4)*x+((k-4)*x)^2)) )).
formula: For fixed k > 0, T(n,k) ~ (2 + sqrt(k))^(2*n + 3/2) / sqrt(8*k*Pi*n). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 31 2020
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := Sum[If[k == 0, Boole[n == j], k^(n - j)] * Binomial[2*j, j] * Binomial[2*n + 1, 2*j], {j, 0, n}]; Table[T[k, n - k], {n, 0, 9}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Amiram Eldar_, Aug 25 2020 *)
results.author: _Seiichi Manyama_, Aug 25 2020
